title: 112_hr4023
content: The Act is titled the "Veterans' Telehealth and Telemedicine Improvement Act" and includes provisions for teleconsultation and telemedicine. The "Veterans' Telehealth and Telemedicine Improvement Act" includes provisions for teleconsultation and teleretinal imaging in the Department of Veterans Affairs. The Act aims to increase the use of teleconsultation, telemedicine, telehealth, and home telehealth, as well as teleretinal imaging within Veterans Integrated Services Network facilities. The Secretary is required to establish technical and clinical care standards in consultation with professional societies. The Secretary must increase the number of patients in teleretinal imaging programs by at least five percent annually. Annual reports on telehealth programs must be submitted to the Committees on Veterans' Affairs. Home telehealth involves using technology for monitoring and transmission. The use of telecommunication and information technology in healthcare includes teleconsultation, telehealth, and telemedicine to support remote patient care and provider collaboration. The term 'telemedicine' encompasses the use of telecommunication and information technology to provide healthcare across geographic distances. 'Teleretinal imaging' involves using technology for remote assessment of eye conditions. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs is implementing telemedicine training for medical residents and providing education on telemedicine for rural veterans. Additionally, incentives are being added to the Veterans Equitable Resource Allocation system to promote the use of teleconsultation, teleretinal imaging, telemedicine, and telehealth services. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs is implementing telemedicine training for medical residents and providing education on telemedicine for rural veterans. Incentives are being added to the Veterans Equitable Resource Allocation system to promote the use of teleconsultation, teleretinal imaging, telemedicine, and telehealth services, including the modification of workload reporting to include all telemedicine visits. Definitions for these terms are provided in section 1709(d) of title 38, United States Code. AUTHORITY TO WAIVE COLLECTION OF COPAYMENTS FOR TELEHEALTH AND TELEMEDICINE VISITS OF VETERANS. The Secretary may waive copayments for telehealth and telemedicine visits of veterans under the laws administered by the Secretary. Definitions for various telehealth terms are provided in the amendment. Waiver of copayments for telehealth and telemedicine visits of veterans under laws administered by the Secretary.
